glassmith_furnace.description: Here the Glassmith can melt glass and start their production.
glassmith_furnace.recipe_description: The primary workstation of a Glassmith, with a strong stone crucible and a marble table for marvering.
glassmith_furnace.flavor: That marble table top is so IN!

glassmith_bench.description: All these tools are always at the Glassmith's disposal.
glassmith_bench.recipe_description: An important workstation, the bench is required for assembling many items and for free-blowing.

glassmith_glory_hole.description: Not too hot, not too cold, a gloriously perfect hole.
glassmith_glory_hole.recipe_description: A glory hole is important to preserve recently melted globs in working temperature.
glassmith_glory_hole.flavor: Glassworkers might have issues naming their furnaces...

glassmith_annealing_forge.description: Used to let your glassware cool down properly.
glassmith_annealing_forge.recipe_description: The annealing forge is necessary to let your glassware slowly cool down without shattering.

l_1.name: Standard Catalog
l_1.desc: The Glassmith is capable of working molten forest glass into molds and crown glass panes.

l_2.name: Free-Blowing
l_2.desc: The Glassmith has started mastering the art of freely working molten glass.

l_3.name: Journeyman's Knowledge
l_3.desc: When inspiration strikes, the Glassmith may now craft an especially Fine quality of item.

l_3_2.name: Work Transparence
l_3_2.desc: The Glassmith has refined the melting techniques and can now produce colorless glass!

l_4.name: Extended Catalog
l_4.desc: The Glassmith has improved enough to start venturing into more complex and artistical ideas.

l_4_2.name: Stained Glass
l_4_2.desc: The Glassmith can now work with different minerals to create beautiful and bright glass colors!

l_5.name: Master's Insight
l_5.desc: The Glassmith can now create items of Excellent quality, and will make Fine quality items more often.

l_6.name: Dragon Glass
l_6.desc: The Glassmith has mastered their craft and is now able to bend any glass to their will... even the mythical Obsidian.

info.description: The Glassmith can use fire and skill to turn nature's resources into beautiful, transparent glass to be used in construction, furniture and more.

craft_menu.description: Melt glass and create valuable furniture and items.

green_forest_glass_melt.description: Creates a gather of molten green forest glass to be worked and shaped as desired. Keep the molten glass globs inside a glory hole furnace so they won't cool down.

green_forest_raw_glass_melt.description: Melts the solidified puddle to form another gather of molten green forest glass.
green_forest_raw_glass_melt.flavor: Remember you can use a glory hole furnace to keep the globs hot!

green_forest_cullet_melt.description: Melts a poorly cooled down piece of green forest glass to recyle it into another gather of molten glass.
green_forest_cullet_melt.flavor: Use an annealing forge to properly cool down your glassware!

amber_forest_glass_melt.description: Creates a gather of molten amber forest glass to be worked and shaped as desired. Keep the molten glass globs inside a glory hole furnace so they won't cool down.

amber_forest_raw_glass_melt.description: Melts the solidified puddle to form another gather of molten amber forest glass.
amber_forest_raw_glass_melt.flavor: Remember you can use a glory hole furnace to keep the globs hot!

amber_forest_cullet_melt.description: Melts a poorly cooled down piece of amber forest glass to recyle it into another gather of molten glass.
amber_forest_cullet_melt.flavor: Use an annealing forge to properly cool down your glassware!

colorless_glass_melt.description: Creates a gather of molten colorless glass to be worked and shaped as desired. Keep the molten glass globs inside a glory hole furnace so they won't cool down.

colorless_raw_glass_melt.description: Melts the solidified puddle to form another gather of molten colorless glass.
colorless_raw_glass_melt.flavor: Remember you can use a glory hole furnace to keep the globs hot!

colorless_cullet_melt.description: Melts a poorly cooled down piece of colorless glass to recyle it into another gather of molten glass.
colorless_cullet_melt.flavor: Use an annealing forge to properly cool down your glassware!

obsidian_ingot_recipe.description: By masterfully combining Obsidian and Titanium the Glassmith can create an alloy usable by a Blacksmith.

raw_obsidian_recipe.description: Merge together some shards of Obsidian to form a larger chunk.
raw_obsidian_recipe.flavor: It is said somewhere that only the fire of a Dragon can melt this glass. Nonsense!

green_forest_crown_glass.description: By blowing a glass glob into a large bubble and then flattening it, several disk-shaped glass sheets can be created.

colorless_crown_glass.description: By blowing a glass glob into a large bubble and then flattening it, several disk-shaped glass sheets can be created.

amber_forest_crown_glass.description: By blowing a glass glob into a large bubble and then flattening it, several disk-shaped glass sheets can be created.

glassmith_outfit.description: The apron is recommended when dealing with sticky blobs of molten fluids.

glassmith_blowpipe.description: Alongside the pontil, the two most basic tools of a glassblower.

calcium_salts.description: Common metallic salts often used in building and reactions like coloring glass.

chromium_salts.description: An uncommon metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

cobalt_salts.description: A common metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

copper_salts.description: A common metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

iron_salts.description: A common metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

manganese_salts.description: A common metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

nickel_salts.description: A rare metallic salt often found in galena veins with silver.

titanium_salts.description: A rare metallic salt, Titanium is quite coveted for its endurance and beauty.

tin_salts.description: A common metallic salt used for chemical reactions like coloring glass.

minerals.description: Diverse minerals, like arsenic and sulfur, that might have various uses.

silver_flakes.description: Used to make pretty things - like coloring glass.

wood_ash.description: Wood ash obtained from burning charcoal.

soda_ash.description: Salty ash obtained from burning certain types of herbs.

obsidian_ingot.description: An amazing obsidian-titanium alloy created by a Master Glassmith.

fine_sand.description: Its coarse and rough and irritating and it gets everywhere.

crown_window_clay_colored.description: A crown glass latticed colored clay window.
crown_window_clay_colored.fd_display_name: Green Forest Crown Colored Clay Window
crown_window_clay_colored.fo_display_name: Amber Forest Crown Colored Clay Window

window_clay_tall_colored.fg_display_name: Green Forest Tall Colored Clay Window
window_clay_tall_colored.fo_display_name: Amber Forest Tall Colored Clay Window
window_clay_tall_colored.description: A beautiful glasswork to an already elegant window.
window_clay_tall_colored.lb_display_name: Light Blue Tall Colored Clay Window

crown_window_clay_tall_colored.description: A crown glass tall colored clay latticed window.
crown_window_clay_tall_colored.cl_display_name: Colorless Crown Tall Colored Clay Window
crown_window_clay_tall_colored.fg_display_name: Green Forest Crown Tall Colored Clay Window
crown_window_clay_tall_colored.fo_display_name: Amber Forest Crown Tall Colored Clay Window

door_clay_blue.description: A touch of sky under the desert sun.

door_clay_green.description: A true homage to the cacti.

door_clay_red.description: A fine work for a fine home.
door_clay_red.fo_display_name: Amber Forest Crown Red Clay Door

door_clay_glass.description: A magnificent door for a fortunate hearthling!

door_wooden_2.description: For when you're both afraid and curious.

door_wooden_double.description: Allows up to two curious neighbors to peek inside.

door_wooden_glass_double.fg_display_name: Green Forest Glass & Wooden Double Door
door_wooden_glass_double.fo_display_name: Amber Forest Glass & Wooden Double Door
door_wooden_glass_double.lb_display_name: Light Blue Glass & Wooden Double Door

window_stained_arch.g1_description: A stained glass masterwork worthy of the Ascendancy and all the followers of Cid.
window_stained_arch.g2_display_name: 'The Path of the Monkey' Arch Window
window_stained_arch.g2_description: A true stained glass masterwork that will earn the praise of all Rayya's Children.
window_stained_arch.sp1_description: A beautiful stained glass piece that highlights the hardworking, gifted nature of your hearthlings and their crafts.
window_stained_arch.sp2_description: An impressive stained glass panel that represents the bravery and military mighty of this people.
window_stained_arch.sp3_display_name: 'The Riches of the Land' Arch Window
window_stained_arch.sp3_description: An awe-inspiring glasswork that depicts the cunning nature and all the riches of the land and its hearthlings.

pack_sand.description: Compress sand to form tighter and easier to manage piles of packed sand. In this more convenient form, sand can be sold to traders.

glass_mold.description: Creates a mold that can be used by a glassmith to create simple glassware. It must be broken after it is used.

glassmith_blowpipe_recipe.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Glassmith.
glassmith_blowpipe_recipe.flavor: It should probably be longer... for safety.

burn_charcoal_recipe.description: Produces one lump of coal and two bits of Wood Ash.

burn_soda_herbs_recipe.description: Some herbs have unique properties and when burned they will yield a bit of Soda Ash.
burn_soda_herbs_recipe.flavor: Mom says it's called Sodium Carbonate...

sand_extraction.description: There might be residual sand inside a pile of clay that the potter can recover with patience.
sand_extraction.flavor: Maybe if we crunch it enough?...

sand_extraction.description: There might be residual sand inside a hunk of stone that the mason can recover with patience.

copper_ore_refining.description: By treating a chunk of copper ore you may acquire two bits of copper salt and some cobalt salt.

iron_ore_refining.description: By treating a chunk of iron ore you may acquire two bits of iron salt and some manganese salt.

tin_ore_refining.description: By treating a chunk of tin ore you may acquire two bits of tin salt and some minerals.

stone_refining.description: By treating a chunk of stone you may recover some calcium salt and minerals.

silver_flakes_recipe.description: Used to make pretty stuff - like glass!

silver_flakes_times_three_recipe.description: Smash up a Silver Bar to get the Flakes back out of it!
silver_flakes_times_three_recipe.flavor: Right about the perfect amount of Shine!

window_frame.description: Create a small square stone window frame.

window_frame_round.description: Create a small and round stone window frame.

window_frame_tall.description: Create a large and tall stone window frame.
window_frame_tall.flavor: It's like a little stone door.

window_frame_wide.description: Create a short but wide stone window frame.

window_frame_arch.description: Create a majestic tall and wide stone window frame.
window_frame_arch.flavor: The fancier the building, the taller the windows.

arrow.description: An arrow with an obsidian tip.

using_arrow.description: Currently using obsidian arrows, which deals additional damage over time and slows down enemies. Click to swap between arrow types.

quiver.description: Powerful, obsidian-tipped arrows that can damage and slow foes over time.

archer_debuff.description: Wounded by obsidian! Slowed down and taking damage every 3 minutes for 12 minutes.

cleric_buff.description: Increases Courage and Compassion by 15% and slightly increases speed.

helm.description: The best protection for your head.

mail.description: A full set of obsidian chainmail.

plate.description: A full set of obsidian plate armor and mail.

spear.description: A one-handed short spear with an obsidian tip.

two_handed.description: Big. Bad. Beautiful. A formidable weapon for formidable foes. (Two-handed)
two_handed.flavor: The apex of the Obsidian Armory

table_clay.description: There's something funny about being able to stare at your feet while eating.

table_dining.description: Easier to clean after big feasts.

table_one.description: A simple yet nice glass table.

table_stone.description: Some things are set on stone. In this case, it is glass.

wooden_sign_glassmith.description: A sign with the mark of the glassmith, to be placed on buildings.
wooden_sign_glassmith.placed_description: A sign with the mark of the Glassmith.

wood_shelf.description: A sturdy wooden shelf with glass pots for mass storing metallic salts and flakes.

stone_shelf.description: A sturdy stone shelf with glass pots for mass storing metallic salts and flakes.

clay_shelf.description: A sturdy clay shelf with glass pots for mass storing metallic salts and flakes.

pot_copper_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Copper Salts.
pot_copper_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Copper Salts.

urn_minerals.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Minerals.
urn_minerals.ghost_description: Harvest it for more than thirty units of Minerals.

pot_calcium_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Calcium Salts.
pot_calcium_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Calcium Salts.

pot_chromium_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Chromium Salts.
pot_chromium_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Chromium Salts.

pot_cobalt_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Cobalt Salts.
pot_cobalt_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Cobalt Salts.

pot_iron_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Iron Salts.
pot_iron_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Iron Salts.

pot_manganese_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Manganese Salts.
pot_manganese_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Manganese Salts.

pot_nickel_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Nickel Salts.
pot_nickel_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Nickel Salts.

pot_tin_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Tin Salts.
pot_tin_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Tin Salts.

pot_titanium_salts.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Titanium Salts.
pot_titanium_salts.ghost_description: Harvest it for twenty units of Titanium Salts.

urn_soda_ash.ghost_description: Harvest it for more than thirty units of Soda Ash.
urn_soda_ash.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Soda Ash.

urn_wood_ash.ghost_description: Harvest it for more than thirty units of Wood Ash.
urn_wood_ash.iconic_description: Place it so it can be harvested for Wood Ash.
